alert.note: Alert for Salt Lake (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 8:52PM MDT until May 04 at 11:06AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Utah... South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville affecting Weber County. Emigration Creek In Emigration Canyon and east bench of Salt Lake City affecting Salt Lake County. Little Bear River At Paradise affecting Cache County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. Minor flooding is ongoing or forecast along the South Fork of the Ogden River near Huntsville, Emigration Creek near Salt Lake City, and the Little Bear River at Paradise ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast Tuesday and Wednesday evenings. * WHERE...Emigration Creek In Emigration Canyon and east bench of Salt Lake City. * WHEN...Until late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 130.0 cfs, minor flood damage will impact homes and structures along Emigration Creek, including areas of the Hogle Zoo. At 169.0 cfs, Moderate flooding will affect select homes and structures along Emigration Creek. Additionally, structures in the Hogle Zoo will receive damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM MDT Tuesday the flow was 144.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river will rise to 160.0 cfs just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight to 110.0 cfs early tomorrow afternoon. It will rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to 162.0 cfs early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage again early Thursday morning. - Flood flow is 126.0 cfs. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Wednesday at 1200 PM MDT.
